location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of covering letters produced to enclose various licences granted in pursuance of the Dangerous Drugs Acts 1920-32. The original export and Home Office licences are not included in the file.The correspondents include: the Political Agent, Bahrain to the Under Secretary of State for India, India Office; and the India Office to the Under Secretary of State, Home Office.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
